topic.shortdesc: Compact the data files in an incremental backup.

section.title: Description
section.p: Backup uses ForestDB as the underlying data store for backup data and is an append-only storage engine. To defragment the data files after they are written, they need to be compacted.
By default, compaction is not run as a part of an incremental backup and must be triggered as a separate step.

section.title: Options
section.p:
The following are the command options:
compact options
Option Description
--dir /[directory name] Name of the backup directory.
--name REPOSITORY-NAME Name of the backup repository.
--incr-backup BACKUP-TIMESTAMP Timestamp of the incremental backup.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Run the compact command to compact data files in backup archive travel after the incremental backup with the named timestamp:./backup compact --dir /tmp/backups --name travel --incr-backup 2016-01-22T15:42:41.383468246-08:00
